thread.section_title: Jose Mourinho would be happy for Zlatan Ibrahimovic if he decides to quit Manchester United – Metro
thread.title: Jose Mourinho would be happy for Zlatan Ibrahimovic if he decides to quit Manchester United
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho would be happy for Zlatan Ibrahimovic if he decides to quit Manchester United

author: jsgoldman
title: Jose Mourinho would be happy for Zlatan Ibrahimovic if he decides to quit Manchester United
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has scored 26 goals in 41 appearances for Manchester United this season (Picture: Getty) Jose Mourinho insists he will be happy for Zlatan Ibrahimovic if he decides to quit Manchester United at the end of the season.
Alexis Sanchez gives Chelsea major hope with latest interview on Arsenal future The veteran striker has made a huge impact at Old Trafford following his move last summer, scoring 26 goals, including the dramatic late winner in the EFL Cup final win over Southampton, in 41 appearances.
Ibrahimovic signed a one-year deal last summer but has the option to extend for a further 12 months. United are keen to for the 35-year-old to commit for another season but Mourinho insists he will hold no grudges if his top goalscorer were to seek a fresh challenge.
Ibrahimovic scored a match-winning double in last month’s EFL Cup final win over Southampton (Picture: Getty) ‘I am just calm and waiting for the decision,’ Mourinho told Sky Sports.
‘If the decision is for him to stay and he is happy with that, we are delighted with that.
‘If his decision is to leave and try to find a different challenge, I will be also happy for him.
More: Football Jose Mourinho speaks out over Man United's interest for 'absurd' £173m superstar 
Antonio Conte in disagreement with Chelsea's board over £70m transfer 
Bradley Lowery forced to cancel hospital visit from hero Jermain Defoe 
‘He is [a big part of our success this season], but the human being is more important than the player and the team.
‘If his decision is to leave and try to be happy with his family and have a different reality, so be it.’
MORE: Jose Mourinho wants to add five players to his Manchester United squad with Griezmann, Bakayoko, Mbappe, Fabinho and Giminez targeted
